content: Prepare the bok choy. You can use any kind of bok choy you like for this recipe, including baby, mature, or Shanghai bok choy. To prepare the bok choy: [1] Cut off the very end of the stem that’s keeping the leaves together. Separate the bok choy, but leave the center leaf bulb intact. Wash the leaves and stems by running them under cold water. Make sure you rub the bottom of the stem well to remove dirt from around where the roots were. Pat dry with a clean towel. If you aren't using baby bok choy, cut the leaves off the stems, keeping the two pieces separate. Cut the leaves and stems into one-inch (2.5-cm) chunks. Baby bok choy is already bite-sized and has more tender stems, so it doesn’t have to be cut up. Mince the garlic and (optional) ginger. Peel the skin off the cloves of garlic and the fresh ginger. With a sharp knife, carefully mince the garlic and ginger together. You can also use a microplane grater or garlic press to mince these two ingredients. To peel garlic more easily, shake the cloves in a tin can for 10 seconds to loosen the skin. [2] Cook the garlic and ginger. Heat a wok or sauté pan over medium–high heat and add your cooking oil. Add the garlic and ginger and cook until they become fragrant and turn a light golden brown, about two minutes. Don’t cook the ginger and garlic for too long, because the garlic will burn quickly and become bitter. [3] The best oils for this dish are peanut, vegetable, or canola. [4] Add the bok choy. Start by cooking the stems first if you're working with Shanghai or mature bok choy. Cook them for one to two minutes, until the stems start to become translucent. [5] Add the leaves and toss the bok choy in the oil for 15 seconds. Pour in the vegetable broth. Then cover the bok choy with a lid and cook it for one minute. Remove the pan from the heat after that time and remove the lid. Instead of vegetable broth, you can also use beef or chicken broth, water, white wine, or rice wine vinegar. Season and serve. You can season the bok choy with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, to taste. [6] Toss the bok choy to coat it with the seasoning, then transfer it to a large serving platter. This recipe makes enough to serve about four people. Steam the bok choy. Run the bok choy under cold water to wash off dirt. You can cut the baby bok choy in half lengthwise, if you wish, but you can also leave it whole. Steam the bok choy for about six minutes, or until the base is tender and can easily be pierced with a fork or knife. [7] There are many ways you can steam greens, including: With an electric steamer. Fill the bottom with water as recommended by the manufacturer. Replace the steamer basket, then put in the bok choy. Put the lid on and turn the machine on. With a saucepan and steamer insert. Fill a saucepan with an inch (2.5 cm) of water. Place the metal steamer insert into the bottom of the pan. If the water comes up through the holes in the steamer bottom, pour some out. Bring the water to a boil, then place the steamer basket full of bok choy into the bottom and put the lid back on. [8] Mince and cook the garlic and ginger. Peel the garlic and ginger. Then mince them using a sharp knife, garlic press, or microplane grater. Heat the oil over medium heat in a small frying pan. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for one minute. [9] Remove the pan from the heat. Mix the dressing together. In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar, sesame oil, soy sauce, and lemon juice. When the ingredients are combined, whisk them into the garlic and ginger mixture. Toss the salad and serve with sesame seeds. Remove the bok choy from the steamer and transfer it to a large bowl. Pour the dressing over top, and toss to coat the bok choy. Sprinkle the toasted sesame seeds onto the bok choy. Divide the salad into four portions and serve. Heat the grill and make the miso butter. You can use an electric grill, charcoal grill, or barbecue. Heat it on medium–high heat. To make the miso butter, simply mix the miso and butter together in a small bowl with a fork. You can also use margarine or coconut oil as an alternative to the butter. Prepare the bok choy. Cut the leaves off the stems of the bok choy. Cut the stems in half lengthwise. Wash the stems and leaves under cold running water, and then pat them dry with a towel. Cut the leaves into long strips and set them aside in a heat-proof bowl. Use a butter knife to coat the bok choy stems with the miso butter. [10] Grill the bok choy stems. Place the bok choy stems cut-side down on the grill and close the lid. Cook for about five minutes, then use tongs or a metal spatula to flip them over. Cook for another five or six minutes, until both sides are golden brown, tender, and slightly crispy. Wilt the leaves. Drizzle oil and lemon juice over the bok choy leaves and toss to coat. Remove the stems from the grill and place them on top of the leaves. Let the grilled bok choy sit on the leaves for a few moments before serving. This will wilt the leaves and make them tender and warm. Season with salt and pepper before serving. Add salt and pepper to taste, then divide the grilled bok choy into four servings. [11] Finished.

<p>Bok choy is a tasty and nutritious leafy green vegetable that can be cooked and eaten in a variety of ways. It’s actually related to cabbage and broccoli, it’s low in calories, and it’s high in lots of vitamins and minerals. Bok choy makes a great snack or side dish, and you can eat it cooked or raw. Some of the most popular ways to cook it include stir frying, sautéing, steaming, grilling, and roasting.</p>

<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Prepare the bok choy.</b> You can use any kind of bok choy you like for this recipe, including baby, mature, or Shanghai bok choy. To prepare the bok choy:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Cut off the very end of the stem that’s keeping the leaves together.</li>
<li>Separate the bok choy, but leave the center leaf bulb intact.</li>
<li>Wash the leaves and stems by running them under cold water. Make sure you rub the bottom of the stem well to remove dirt from around where the roots were. Pat dry with a clean towel.</li>
<li>If you aren't using baby bok choy, cut the leaves off the stems, keeping the two pieces separate. Cut the leaves and stems into one-inch (2.5-cm) chunks.</li>
<li>Baby bok choy is already bite-sized and has more tender stems, so it doesn’t have to be cut up.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/71/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-2-Version-5.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/08/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-2-Version-5.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-2-Version-4.jpg" data-src="/4/47/Cook Bok Choy Step 2 Version 5.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-c4a1d38524" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bok Choy"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Mince the garlic and (optional) ginger.</b> Peel the skin off the cloves of garlic and the fresh ginger. With a sharp knife, carefully mince the garlic and ginger together.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-c4a1d38524'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>You can also use a microplane grater or garlic press to mince these two ingredients.</li>
<li>To peel garlic more easily, shake the cloves in a tin can for 10 seconds to loosen the skin.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bf/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-3-Version-4.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/45/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-3-Version-4.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-3-Version-4.jpg" data-src="/5/5b/Cook Bok Choy Step 3 Version 4.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-1cd0227e1f" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bok Choy"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Cook the garlic and ginger.</b> Heat a wok or sauté pan over medium–high heat and add your cooking oil. Add the garlic and ginger and cook until they become fragrant and turn a light golden brown, about two minutes.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-1cd0227e1f'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Don’t cook the ginger and garlic for too long, because the garlic will burn quickly and become bitter.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>The best oils for this dish are peanut, vegetable, or canola.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/42/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-4-Version-5.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/5c/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-4-Version-5.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-4-Version-4.jpg" data-src="/3/3d/Cook Bok Choy Step 4 Version 5.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-80dc7a8f71" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bok Choy"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add the bok choy.</b> Start by cooking the stems first if you're working with Shanghai or mature bok choy. Cook them for one to two minutes, until the stems start to become translucent.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-80dc7a8f71'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Add the leaves and toss the bok choy in the oil for 15 seconds.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d7/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-5-Version-5.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/23/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-5-Version-5.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/a/a8/Cook Bok Choy Step 5 Version 5.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-9ee0baed8a" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bok Choy"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pour in the vegetable broth.</b> Then cover the bok choy with a lid and cook it for one minute. Remove the pan from the heat after that time and remove the lid.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-9ee0baed8a'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Instead of vegetable broth, you can also use beef or chicken broth, water, white wine, or rice wine vinegar.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" height="410" id="img_7d3ea09228" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7d3ea09228')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Season and serve.</b> You can season the bok choy with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, to taste.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup> Toss the bok choy to coat it with the seasoning, then transfer it to a large serving platter.

<ul>
<li>This recipe makes enough to serve about four people.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Making_Steamed_Bok_Choy_Salad_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Making_Steamed_Bok_Choy_Salad">Making Steamed Bok Choy Salad</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-7.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-7.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-7.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-7.jpg" height="546" id="img_0aed6c3404" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0aed6c3404')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-7.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-7.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Steam the bok choy.</b> Run the bok choy under cold water to wash off dirt. You can cut the baby bok choy in half lengthwise, if you wish, but you can also leave it whole. Steam the bok choy for about six minutes, or until the base is tender and can easily be pierced with a fork or knife.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup> There are many ways you can steam greens, including:

<ul>
<li>With an electric steamer. Fill the bottom with water as recommended by the manufacturer. Replace the steamer basket, then put in the bok choy. Put the lid on and turn the machine on.</li>
<li>With a saucepan and steamer insert. Fill a saucepan with an inch (2.5 cm) of water. Place the metal steamer insert into the bottom of the pan. If the water comes up through the holes in the steamer bottom, pour some out. Bring the water to a boil, then place the steamer basket full of bok choy into the bottom and put the lid back on.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-8.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-8.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-8.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-8.jpg" height="546" id="img_44940c07ba" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_44940c07ba')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-8.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-8.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Mince and cook the garlic and ginger.</b> Peel the garlic and ginger. Then mince them using a sharp knife, garlic press, or microplane grater.

<ul>
<li>Heat the oil over medium heat in a small frying pan. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for one minute.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup> Remove the pan from the heat.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-9.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_ff3c54158c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ff3c54158c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-9.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Mix the dressing together.</b> In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar, sesame oil, soy sauce, and lemon juice. When the ingredients are combined, whisk them into the garlic and ginger mixture.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-10.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-10.jpg" height="546" id="img_67f4f37437" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_67f4f37437')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-10.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Toss the salad and serve with sesame seeds.</b> Remove the bok choy from the steamer and transfer it to a large bowl. Pour the dressing over top, and toss to coat the bok choy.

<ul>
<li>Sprinkle the toasted sesame seeds onto the bok choy. Divide the salad into four portions and serve.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Grilling_Bok_Choy_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Grilling_Bok_Choy">Grilling Bok Choy</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-11.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-11.jpg" height="546" id="img_c6c3ae9bca" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c6c3ae9bca')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-11.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Heat the grill and make the miso butter.</b> You can use an electric grill, charcoal grill, or barbecue. Heat it on medium–high heat.

<ul>
<li>To make the miso butter, simply mix the miso and butter together in a small bowl with a fork.</li>
<li>You can also use margarine or coconut oil as an alternative to the butter.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-12.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-12.jpg" height="546" id="img_d6da6da070" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d6da6da070')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-12.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Prepare the bok choy.</b> Cut the leaves off the stems of the bok choy. Cut the stems in half lengthwise. Wash the stems and leaves under cold running water, and then pat them dry with a towel.

<ul>
<li>Cut the leaves into long strips and set them aside in a heat-proof bowl.</li>
<li>Use a butter knife to coat the bok choy stems with the miso butter.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-13.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_617a61207c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_617a61207c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-13.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Grill the bok choy stems.</b> Place the bok choy stems cut-side down on the grill and close the lid. Cook for about five minutes, then use tongs or a metal spatula to flip them over.

<ul>
<li>Cook for another five or six minutes, until both sides are golden brown, tender, and slightly crispy.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-14.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_b4add8280e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b4add8280e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-14.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Wilt the leaves.</b> Drizzle oil and lemon juice over the bok choy leaves and toss to coat. Remove the stems from the grill and place them on top of the leaves.

<ul>
<li>Let the grilled bok choy sit on the leaves for a few moments before serving. This will wilt the leaves and make them tender and warm.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-15.jpg?ajax=true&aid=236379" href="#/Image:Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-15.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bok Choy Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-15.jpg/aid236379-v4-728px-Cook-Bok-Choy-Step-15.jpg" height="546" id="img_574015fbf8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_574015fbf8')</script>

<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Season with salt and pepper before serving.</b> Add salt and pepper to taste, then divide the grilled bok choy into four servings.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="68448" data-caid="69321" data-cqid="68465" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="563188" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="10">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can bok choy be boiled?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, you can boil bok choy. Fill a large pot with water and add a generous amount of salt. Bring the water to a boil. Cut the bok choy in half lengthwise and rinse it under running water. When the water is boiling, add the bok choy and boil it for about five minutes. </div>

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>2</span></a>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="68273" data-caid="69146" data-cqid="68290" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="457904" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="1" data-votes_up="6">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can you eat bok choy raw?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, bok choy can be eaten raw. It has tender leaves, crunchy stalks, and a hint of sweetness in the flavor. Bok choy is great in salads, can be mixed with other greens, or is delicious on its own with your favorite dressings. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="525260" data-caid="526133" data-cqid="525277" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2060323" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="0">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">

<div class="qa_q_txt question">Does bok choy cause gas when eaten?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>

<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>

<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes. They are cruciferous vegetables, and can cause bad gas. </div>

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To cook bok choy, start by cutting off the end of the stem that's holding the leaves together. Then, separate the bok choy into smaller pieces. Next, heat some oil in a pan over medium-high heat and add the bok choy. Let it cook for 1-2 minutes until the stems start to become translucent. Then, pour some water or broth in the pan and cover it. Let the bok choy cook for another minute before serving. <span id="summary_last_sentence">If you want to learn more, like how to steam or grill your bok choy, keep reading the article!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>

title: How to Cook Bok Choy
content_html:
Prepare the bok choy. You can use any kind of bok choy you like for this recipe, including baby, mature, or Shanghai bok choy. To prepare the bok choy:[1]
  • Cut off the very end of the stem that’s keeping the leaves together.
  • Separate the bok choy, but leave the center leaf bulb intact.
  • Wash the leaves and stems by running them under cold water. Make sure you rub the bottom of the stem well to remove dirt from around where the roots were. Pat dry with a clean towel.
  • If you aren't using baby bok choy, cut the leaves off the stems, keeping the two pieces separate. Cut the leaves and stems into one-inch (2.5-cm) chunks.
  • Baby bok choy is already bite-sized and has more tender stems, so it doesn’t have to be cut up.
Mince the garlic and (optional) ginger. Peel the skin off the cloves of garlic and the fresh ginger. With a sharp knife, carefully mince the garlic and ginger together.
  • You can also use a microplane grater or garlic press to mince these two ingredients.
  • To peel garlic more easily, shake the cloves in a tin can for 10 seconds to loosen the skin.[2]
Cook the garlic and ginger. Heat a wok or sauté pan over medium–high heat and add your cooking oil. Add the garlic and ginger and cook until they become fragrant and turn a light golden brown, about two minutes.
  • Don’t cook the ginger and garlic for too long, because the garlic will burn quickly and become bitter.[3]
  • The best oils for this dish are peanut, vegetable, or canola.[4]
Add the bok choy. Start by cooking the stems first if you're working with Shanghai or mature bok choy. Cook them for one to two minutes, until the stems start to become translucent.[5]
  • Add the leaves and toss the bok choy in the oil for 15 seconds.
Pour in the vegetable broth. Then cover the bok choy with a lid and cook it for one minute. Remove the pan from the heat after that time and remove the lid.
  • Instead of vegetable broth, you can also use beef or chicken broth, water, white wine, or rice wine vinegar.
Season and serve. You can season the bok choy with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, to taste.[6] Toss the bok choy to coat it with the seasoning, then transfer it to a large serving platter.
  • This recipe makes enough to serve about four people.
Steam the bok choy. Run the bok choy under cold water to wash off dirt. You can cut the baby bok choy in half lengthwise, if you wish, but you can also leave it whole. Steam the bok choy for about six minutes, or until the base is tender and can easily be pierced with a fork or knife.[7] There are many ways you can steam greens, including:
  • With an electric steamer. Fill the bottom with water as recommended by the manufacturer. Replace the steamer basket, then put in the bok choy. Put the lid on and turn the machine on.
  • With a saucepan and steamer insert. Fill a saucepan with an inch (2.5 cm) of water. Place the metal steamer insert into the bottom of the pan. If the water comes up through the holes in the steamer bottom, pour some out. Bring the water to a boil, then place the steamer basket full of bok choy into the bottom and put the lid back on.[8]
Mince and cook the garlic and ginger. Peel the garlic and ginger. Then mince them using a sharp knife, garlic press, or microplane grater.
  • Heat the oil over medium heat in a small frying pan. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for one minute.[9] Remove the pan from the heat.
Mix the dressing together. In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar, sesame oil, soy sauce, and lemon juice. When the ingredients are combined, whisk them into the garlic and ginger mixture.
Toss the salad and serve with sesame seeds. Remove the bok choy from the steamer and transfer it to a large bowl. Pour the dressing over top, and toss to coat the bok choy.
  • Sprinkle the toasted sesame seeds onto the bok choy. Divide the salad into four portions and serve.
Heat the grill and make the miso butter. You can use an electric grill, charcoal grill, or barbecue. Heat it on medium–high heat.
  • To make the miso butter, simply mix the miso and butter together in a small bowl with a fork.
  • You can also use margarine or coconut oil as an alternative to the butter.
Prepare the bok choy. Cut the leaves off the stems of the bok choy. Cut the stems in half lengthwise. Wash the stems and leaves under cold running water, and then pat them dry with a towel.
  • Cut the leaves into long strips and set them aside in a heat-proof bowl.
  • Use a butter knife to coat the bok choy stems with the miso butter.[10]
Grill the bok choy stems. Place the bok choy stems cut-side down on the grill and close the lid. Cook for about five minutes, then use tongs or a metal spatula to flip them over.
  • Cook for another five or six minutes, until both sides are golden brown, tender, and slightly crispy.
Wilt the leaves. Drizzle oil and lemon juice over the bok choy leaves and toss to coat. Remove the stems from the grill and place them on top of the leaves.
  • Let the grilled bok choy sit on the leaves for a few moments before serving. This will wilt the leaves and make them tender and warm.
Season with salt and pepper before serving. Add salt and pepper to taste, then divide the grilled bok choy into four servings.[11]
Finished.
